headline: How Duke’s Advanced Nuclear and Storage Pivot Could Reshape the Investment Case for Duke Energy (DUK)
summary: Duke Energy has reaffirmed its role in a US Department of Energy cost-share project backing GE Vernova Hitachi’s BWRX-300 small modular reactor technology and is preparing an early site permit application for potential SMR deployment at its Belews Creek, North Carolina site by the end of 2025. Together with its expanding energy storage plans, this advanced nuclear push highlights how Duke is trying to pair grid reliability with lower-carbon power over the long term.
